cover.title: AI coding agents level up: Jules and Claude 4
cover.summary: This edition spotlights two major moves in AI-assisted development: Google Labs’ Jules, an asynchronous autonomous coding agent, and Anthropic’s Claude 4 family.

articles.title: Jules: Google’s autonomous AI coding agent
articles.shortDescription: Google Labs introduces Jules, an asynchronous coding agent designed to help developers build and iterate with less back-and-forth.
articles.fullSummary: Google highlights Jules as an autonomous, asynchronous AI coding agent aimed at helping developers make progress on coding tasks without requiring constant, real-time prompting. The announcement positions Jules as a “build with” assistant that can take on work in the background, supporting developer workflows and reducing the overhead of manual iteration.

articles.title: Introducing Claude 4 (Opus 4 and Sonnet 4)
articles.shortDescription: Anthropic launches Claude Opus 4 and Claude Sonnet 4 with stronger coding, advanced reasoning, and agent-focused capabilities.
articles.fullSummary: Anthropic announces Claude Opus 4 and Claude Sonnet 4 as its next-generation models, emphasizing improvements in coding performance, advanced reasoning, and AI agent workflows. The release includes “extended thinking with tool use” (beta), enabling the models to alternate between reasoning and tools like web search, plus parallel tool use and more precise instruction following.
